Package ohos.data.distributed.device

Interface DeviceKvStore

  • All Superinterfaces:
    KvStore

    public interface DeviceKvStore
extends KvStore
    Manages distributed data by device in a distributed system.

    To create a DeviceKvStore database, you can use the KvManager.getKvStore(Options, String) method with KvStoreType set to DEVICE_COLLABORATION for the input parameter Options. This database manages distributed data by device, and cannot modify data synchronized from remote devices. When an application writes a key-value pair entry into the database, the system automatically adds the ID of the device running the application to the key.

    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Data#DATA_DISTRIBUTEDDATAMGR

        boolean getBoolean​(String deviceId,
                   String key)
            throws KvStoreException
        Obtains the boolean value matching a specified device ID and key.
        Parameters:
        deviceId - Identifies the device whose data is to be queried.
        key - Indicates the key of the boolean value to be queried.
        Returns:
        Returns the boolean value matching the given criteria.
        Throws:
        KvStoreException - Throws this exception if any of the following errors occurs: INVALID_ARGUMENT, SERVER_UNAVAILABLE, IPC_ERROR, DB_ERROR, and KEY_NOT_FOUND.

        KvStoreException
        Since:
        4

      • getResultSet

        KvStoreResultSet getResultSet​(String deviceId,
                              String keyPrefix)
                       throws KvStoreException
        Obtains the KvStoreResultSet object matching the specified device ID and key prefix.

        The KvStoreResultSet object can be used to query all key-value pairs that meet the search criteria. Each KvStore instance can have a maximum of four KvStoreResultSet objects at the same time. If you have created four objects, calling this method will return a failure. Therefore, you are advised to call the closeResultSet method to close unnecessary KvStoreResultSet objects in a timely manner.

        Parameters:
        deviceId - Identifies the device whose data is to be queried.
        keyPrefix - Indicates the key prefix to match.
        Returns:
        Returns the KvStoreResultSet objects.
        Throws:
        KvStoreException - Throws this exception if any of the following errors occurs: INVALID_ARGUMENT, SERVER_UNAVAILABLE, IPC_ERROR, and DB_ERROR.
        Since:
        1

      • getResultSet

        KvStoreResultSet getResultSet​(Query query)
                       throws KvStoreException
        Obtains the KvStoreResultSet object matching the specified Query object.

        Throws:

      • sync

        void sync​(List<String> deviceIdList,
          SyncMode mode)
   throws KvStoreException
        Synchronizes DeviceKvStore databases.

        This method returns immediately and sync result will be returned through asynchronous callback.

        Parameters:
        deviceIdList - Indicates the list of IDs of devices whose DeviceKvStore databases are to be synchronized.
        mode - Indicates the synchronization mode, PUSH, PULL, or PUSH_PULL.
        Throws:
        KvStoreException - Throws this exception if no DeviceKvStore database is available.
        Since:
        1

      • removeDeviceData

        void removeDeviceData​(String deviceId)
               throws KvStoreException
        Removes data of a specified device from the current database. This method is used to remove only the data synchronized from remote devices. This operation does not synchronize data to other databases or affect subsequent data synchronization.
        Parameters:
        deviceId - Identifies the device whose data is to be removed. The value cannot be the current device ID.
        Throws:
        KvStoreException - Throws this exception if any of the following errors occurs: INVALID_ARGUMENT, SERVER_UNAVAILABLE, IPC_ERROR, and DB_ERROR.
        Since:
        1

      • registerSyncCallback

        void registerSyncCallback​(SyncCallback syncCallback)
                   throws KvStoreException
        Register Synchronizes DeviceKvStore databases callback.

        Sync result is returned through asynchronous callback.

        Parameters:
        syncCallback - Indicates the callback used to send the synchronization result to the caller.
        Throws:
        KvStoreException - Throws this exception if no DeviceKvStore database is available.
        Since:
        1

      • unRegisterSyncCallback

        void unRegisterSyncCallback​()
                     throws KvStoreException
        UnRegister Synchronizes DeviceKvStore databases callback.
        Throws:
        KvStoreException - Throws this exception if no DeviceKvStore database is available.
        Since:
        1
